title: I rather see Ryze unplayable then OP every try to balance him failed and hes mechanics arent healthy
body:
"*Why isnt Ryze on your rework list?*"

"*We’re going to try and tackle Ryze before the mid year, we think he’s enough of a problem we need to act sooner . Unclear whether that’ll mean some degree of rework or just significant balance changes.*" http://www.newsoflegends.com/index.php/tag/ryze/

It's hilarious that poor Twisted fate probably mistakenly came in to Ryze flash range and was unable to get out of snares while until dead, becouse Ryze wasn't even ahead.
What's the counter play to this?

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=p9s3917_ztE

**Obviously, Riot a little bit overdid with recent nerfs to Ryze, becouse they were unable to find a proper fix for him at the moment**, but I rather see him unplayable then in the same state as he was in LCS. Ryze is hard - impossible to balance, becouse every try so far have failed and probably requires a Sion level rework.

A lot of Ryze players while trying to prove that he was balanced before these brutal nerfs, are trying to excuse him by using incorrect arguments.

"*He had an average - low win rate*". An average win rate doesn't mean that champions is balanced, especialy then talking about certain champions like Ryze with hes state before the nerfs.

Ryze was insane in SoloQ if mastered. At level 6 as Darius, Nasus or any other tank/fighter, even with  90+ MR I got wrecked while playing against decent-good Ryze players with nearly any meele champion. Starting from level 6 I got one shoted everytime I was in Ryze range.

I remember one game. I was ahead while playing nasus, I had Spectre's cowl, Mercury threads and KindleGem and a full Health. Enemie Ryze roamed me from mid, being barely one level ahead, while having 2 kills. After pushing the wave, he dived me under my tower. I hardly had enought time to flash out off hes endless cc's, but he fallowed me with hes own flash afterwards for a finish combo. **Does it even sound balanced**?

**Edited:**
for people who think that Diana and Malzahar are healthy becouse they're immobile. I will tell you what Riot said about them 3-8 months ago in some of theyr posts. Gonna repost them later if I'll be able to find.

According to Riot, Diana isn't well balanced champion, becouse if ahead, she can burst enemie team in a matter of seconds, if she's not ahead, she feels to weak, becouse she has to get in to people faces, but will get focused and killed before being able to make a noticable impact.

According to Riot, Malzahar isn't very exciting to play and doesn't feel fun to play against eather, becouse of hes frustrating kit.

**Sorry, for not being clearer and not being able to remember everything, but as I said, I gonna edit my post agen if I'll find these specific Rito posts about diana and Malza.**

 If you have read whole post, you probably noticed that I used tank as primary example.

I'm watching this Ryze stack his passive, and Tf not respecting his range, should we nerf Annie and Malz since they have strong flash combos with better CC? Not trying to be rude, but he was clearly getting his passive stacked, and Ryze is clearly a threat with 3 or more stacks.
His play style isn't something that leaves a lot of room for error.  Riots been trying to turn him into a machine gun mage and that leaves a lot of openings for abuse cases.

I think the counterplay could have been to yellow-card him, but yeah, it sucks.  Ryze needs some work.  Landing 1 skill-shot should not instantly decide the outcome of a fight, yet Ryze's followup chain combo pretty much ensures that you die while cc-locked if he is even slightly ahead.  I don't know that Ryze is more toxic than some other champs though, like Riven/Ahri, who can also kill you after landing one CC but don't even need to flash in order to gapclose...

I think Ryze is in the same category as Annie.  They might be a bit toxic/binary, but not quite as oppressive as certain other champions.  As for Malzahar, I don't think he's even really a problem considering he is immobile and suppresses himself in teamfights while being simple to counterbuild during laning.  I think Malzahar is less frustrating/problematic than a lot of common mid laners ({{champion:238}} {{champion:103}}).  People don't like getting CC-locked or bursted, but the balance team needs to be careful not to play favorites.
*cough* ryze doesn't need to lane a skillshot to kill you. His CC is targetted, and his skillshot is being thrown at a snared target.

Okay.  I normally see Ryze lead with the skill shot or throw it simultaneously with the snare so that the skill shot occasionally misses if you try to dodge it, which can mess up his combo.  I don't play Ryze and I haven't seen him very often lately.  I have seen him a few times since that rework, and my experience with him varied quite a lot.  It seemed like some matchups (or it could have been the Ryze player's skill level) were extremely frustrating while other times the Ryze seemed like almost no threat at all.  I think he should be looked at, but I am not convinced he is more frustrating than certain other champions which may be higher priority.
I 100% guarantee it's a skill level thing. Ryze's combo during his 6 seconds at lvl 9 is capable of killing basically anything when done perfectly.

Yeah, I feel like that's sort of the same situation when playing against a Riven that understands how to abuse animation canceling mechanics.  I think that Ryze should be on the list of champions to fix, but I don't feel that he should be dumpstered unless if a handful of other broken/problematic champions are going into the dumpster with him to keep him company.  I am mainly saying that Riot shouldn't play favorites in this case.
Yeah Ryze isn't fun to watch in LCS either. I felt bad for the TF in that video. No nerf, buff or rework can truly fix him.

Where he plays like {{champion:104}}

Ryze was balanced.  He's useless except for those 6-8 seconds hes in his passive.  You cant lose to a ryze who just hits you with Q's and tries to go in for a 3 move combo.  He has clear counter play.  Stay away from him while his passive is up. Oh you got flashed on? React faster and flash away.  Hes 2/3 point and click, so he HAS to be in range to do anything. Stay out of range and your fine. As soon as his passive goes down? Blow him up? Cant blow him up? Hard push him to tower and roam.  Im just tired of people bitching because they die to ryze when they put themselves in the literal worst position to fight him.

He probably needed some number tweaks on abilities, but to cap his passive at 5 is just absurd. Riot has gone to far with this one
